page.title: 03Farming In North Abingdon
page.content: About two thirds of the block is farmland.This compares to about nine tenths forty years ago.Farming in those days after the second world war was mostly dairy farming.The farms were smaller then but there were many more than now. Today there are only 4 farms,mostly engaged in mixed farming (livestock and arable).Peachcroft,which was mainly arable,is now moving to mixed farming and has a shop on the farm which sells its own and other farms produce directly to the public.It has some livestock(pigs,poultry etc.) and some horticulture for people to "pick your own"fruit.Nine people work the farm including the farmer (Mr.Homewood)his wife and two children.The family have run the farm since 1933 but it was a farm at least as early as 1634.
